column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Two more coronavirus-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Thursday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 163 cases of coronavirus were reported on Thursday
column5: 320 on Wednesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 238
column7: 300 cases of the virus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.There are 342 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column8: compared with 346 on Wednesday.The number of patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units was 31 on Thursday
column9: up from 29 on Wednesday.Last updated 30 September at 14:15 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column11: 297 vaccines have been administered in Northern Ireland.Last updated 30 September at 14:15 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 1
column12: 271 cases of coronavirus have been reported in the Republic of Ireland on Thursday
column14: 453 on Wednesday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column16: after 40 deaths were newly notified in the past week.That figure
column18: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.There are 297 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column19: down from 300 on Wednesday.There are 59 patients with Covid-19 in intensive care units
